intro: Hibbertia pilulis, commonly known as the feathered sun-orchid, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers with distinctive, feather-like bracts. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Hibbertia pilulis is an evergreen shrub that produces small, elliptical leaves and blooms from late winter to early spring. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
